original: MAGNUSSON, Edvin (Effe) Valdemar, Chefredaktör, Östersund, f Odenslund, Jämtl l, 19/12 88 av lokför A M o Lovisa Hjort, gm Hedvig Gisslen. Studex 10. Anst Imp.AB K J Karlsson, osund, 10, apotekselev Nordstjernan, Gävle, 10—11, anst Jämtl Tidn 11—13, Östersunds-Posten 13, red.sekr 17, chefred o ansv utg 18. Ag fastigh osund o Böle, Ragunda. Stdflm, led skolstyr, ordf planteringskomm, styr.led i Orkesterföreningen, ordf i ösunds stads nykterhetsnämnd och i länsnykterhets-nämnden o ösunds turistrafikkomm, programchef Radiotjänst osund. Ordf ösunds-Postens Tryckeri AB, Jämtl-Härjedal idr.frb, idrottspl Hofvallens o L A Jonssons skidfabr styr, led Riksidr.frb överstyr, styr.led Skid-främj. Resor: Norge, Danm, Finl, Estl, Tyskl, Holl, Belg, Frankr, Span, Port, Engl, Schweiz, Ital o Fr Marocko. Av trycket: 2 vol »Vem är det?». RVO, TyskRK o österrRK ftjt m krgd, Riksidr.frb ftjt g, Skidfrb, Skidfrämj, Jämtl-Härjed idr.frb, ösunds skidlöp.klubb, IFK o Jämtl l gymn.frb GM, Sv idr.förb SM. Frimurare, Odd Fellow, led Jämtl gille o säll-sk Goda Vänner, medl ett 30-tal polit, kult o humanit frn.
translated: MAGNUSSON, Edvin (Effe) Valdemar, Editor-in-chief, Östersund, born in Odenslund, Jämtland county, on December 19th, 1888, son of locomotive driver A M and Lovisa Hjort, married to Hedvig Gisslen. Graduated with distinction at the age of 10. Employed at Imp.AB K J Karlsson, Östersund, 10, pharmacy apprentice at Nordstjernan, Gävle, 10-11, employed at Jämtl Tidn 11-13, Östersunds-Posten 13, became secretary and editor-in-chief in 17, responsible for editing from 18. Owns properties in Östersund and Böle, Ragunda. Film enthusiast, member of the school board, chairman of the plantation committee, board member of the Orkesterföreningen (Orchestra Association), chairman of the temperance board in Östersund and the county temperance board, and Östersund's tourist traffic committee, program director at Radiotjänst Östersund. Chairman of Östersunds-Postens Tryckeri AB, Jämtl-Härjedal sport association, Hofvallen sports field, and L A Jonsson's ski factory, board member of the National Sports Federation, board member of Skidfrämj (Ski Promotion). Has traveled to Norway, Denmark, Finland, Estonia, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Spain, Portugal, England, Switzerland, Italy, and French Morocco. Author of two volumes of "Who is it?". Recipient of the Royal Order of Vasa, German Red Cross and Austrian Red Cross honorary titles with decorations, Swedish National Sports Federation honorary title with a gold medal, Skidfrb, Skidfrämj, Jämtl-Härjed sports association, Östersund Ski Running Club, IFK and Jämtland gymnastics association Swedish championship titles. Freemason, Odd Fellow, member of Jämtland society and association "Goda Vänner" (Good Friends), affiliated with approximately 30 political, cultural, and humanitarian organizations.
